snippet: More than any state in the West, Utah has expanded hunting opportunities for the well-to-do and has begun to diminish them for those seeking permits directly from the state.
abstract: Utah, more than any state in the West, has expanded hunting opportunities for wealthy buyers of public licenses and has begun to diminish them for those seeking permits directly from the state; state has embraced increasingly free-market model as way to raise money for wildlife conservation.
lead_paragraph: More than any state in the West, Utah has expanded hunting opportunities for the well-to-do and has begun to diminish them for those seeking permits directly from the state.

headline.seo: Auctions Introduce Market Forces to Conservation, but Hunters Cry Foul
headline.main: Utah Hunters Criticize Market Approach to Licenses and Conservation
headline.print_headline: Utah Hunters Criticize Market Approach to Licenses and Conservation
